item.title: Road surface terrible, to many potholes to log, 23rd November
item.description:
Heading towards Coronation Square up the hill Princess Elizabeth way, 2 very large rectangular potholes on the left hand side, various other potholes along there, year after year it is repaired which only lasts a few months and the surface breaks up again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 311, Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Northbound from Stow Court to Malvern Road, 23rd November
item.description:
The north bound section from aproximately Stow Court to Malvern road is absolutely lethal for cyclists. Riding on the left hand side anywhere near the kerb is dangerous due to the current pot holes, the previous bad patching of pot holes and bad resurfacing. Please have someone attempt the ride on a cycle to experience it. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large part of road tarmac missing and deteriorating., 23rd November
item.description:
Outside 8 New Barn Close and on other locations in that close. As the road is narrow traffic has to constantly drive across the long pothole which is deteriorating.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, New Barn Close, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No dropped curb! Canâ€™t use in wheelchair, 23rd November
item.description:
This street, and many others of North Upton Lane do not have drop curbs, and therefore I cannot travel on my wheelchair from Abbeymead to Hucclecote. It is very frustrating when, in this day and age, there are not drop curbs on roads. I have a new wheelchair, but I feel I cannot go out as most of the pavements are inaccessible to me.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Upton Lane, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continual Flooding of Leckhampton road footpath, 23rd November
item.description:
I notice today that you are putting in a new surface on the path in Mornington Drive, which is little used, but nothing is done along Leckhampton road, from approx Halland Road to the Norwood. When it rains it's now virtually impossible to walk along the path and you either have to cross the road or walk in the road. I know its difficult as the path is below the road, and it has lots of tree roots, and you have cleaned some drains, but its beyond a joke and needs a solution before somebody gets knocked down walking on the road. I have sent a selection of photos which I took in the summer, but can send more as it happens every time we get more than drizzle.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 63, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rocking and broken slabs on a narrow stretch of pavement on Montpellier Walk outside The Ivy/Harry Cook and further along outside AllBarOne, 23rd November
item.description:
The paving slabs are broken and rock when stepped on, which could easily result in tripping up a pedestrian. There is nowhere else to walk except for the road as the walkway is so narrow at this point

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Walk, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
